articles.author: Pete Thomas
articles.title: Rare battle between rhino and buffalo caught on video - For The Win
articles.description: A ranger in South Africa’s Kariega Game Reserve has captured “extremely rare” footage showing a white rhinoceros in head-to-head battle with a Cape buffalo.
articles.content:
A ranger in a South African game reserve has captured extremely rare footage showing a white rhinoceros in head-to-head battle with a ferocious buffalo.
The tale of the tape favors the rhino they ca… [+1080 chars]

articles.title: Africa: Diabetes Equates the Rich and the Poor - AllAfrica - Top Africa News
articles.description: Although for different reasons, diabetes appears to be one of the few cases that put rich and poor societies at equal footing. In either case, diabetes is caused by wrong, dangerous to health nutritional habits.

articles.title: Diabetes in Africa 'could reach 55mln by 2045' - Sub-Saharan Africa - Sub-Saharan Africa English
articles.description: The number of people living with diabetes in Africa could rise from 24 million this year to 55 million by 2045, research suggests.

articles.title: Africa has sights set on hydrocarbon haul despite global shift - Reuters
articles.description: Several African countries plan to exploit their oil and gas reserves to tackle poverty and energy shortages, representatives gathered in Dubai said this week in the face of pressure to end fossil fuel extraction to curb global warming.
